ground_truth: Graham puts Bo down in the hallway and she stands close to him as the four of them stand quietly in a tight group. Morgan looks at his father, unable to speak, and all four look up. Merrill looks up the stairs at the boarded bedroom doors as Graham takes Morgan's hand and smiles down at his son, who smiles gently back. The group of four turns and watches the top of the stairs, and Merrill's eyes move quietly above the bedroom doors to the ceiling of the upstairs hallway, where he stares at a rectangle with a tiny rope hanging from it. Morgan and Bo are frozen watching a set of long fingers reach under the front door, which change to the exact color and texture of the yellow cracked paint on the door. Graham and Merrill arrive in the front hall, and Graham takes Morgan and Bo by the hand, leading them quickly down the hall as Merrill backs away while watching the top of the stairs. Graham comes down the last few steps and enters the basement, closing the door behind him, which has no lock. The basement is lined with metal shelves cluttered with canned goods, extension cords, cleaning supplies, decorations, and outdoor tools. Merrill rummages through the shelves frantically as Graham puts his ear to the door and listens. Merrill moves to another set of shelves, knocking things to the ground, and there is scratching against the door. The doorknob turns, and Graham grabs it with both hands as the door begins to push open. A single light bulb hangs from a wire in the ceiling, the only light in the room. Merrill reaches between two stacks of shelves and pulls out a pick for digging in the ground with a three-foot wooden handle, holding it up in the air. He turns and rushes in Graham's direction, clipping the light bulb with the end of the wooden handle as he crosses the room. Merrill turns the channel knob and checks all the stations, listening to the light hum from the speakers. Graham steps into the beam of lights, looks at the door, and then turns to face the lights. Graham looks at Merrill's corner of the darkness as Morgan moves his beam onto Merrill, putting the flashlight on the ground and rolling it across. The flashlight comes to a stop in Graham's palm, and he picks it up. Merrill slowly catches his breath and reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight, training the beam. Merrill looks at his nephew turning gray as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body and talks into the child's ear.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Graham places Bo down in the corridor and she stands near to him as the four of them stand silently in a tight cluster. Morgan glances at his father, unable to articulate, and all four gaze up. Merrill gazes up the stairs at the sealed bedroom doors as Graham takes Morgan's hand and beams down at his son, who beams softly back. The cluster of four turns and observes the top of the stairs, and Merrill's eyes shift silently above the bedroom doors to the ceiling of the upstairs corridor, where he gazes at a rectangle with a tiny cord hanging from it. Morgan and Bo are frozen observing a set of long digits reach beneath the front door, which transform to the exact hue and texture of the yellow cracked paint on the door. Graham and Merrill reach in the front hall, and Graham takes Morgan and Bo by the hand, guiding them quickly down the hall as Merrill retreats while observing the top of the stairs. Graham descends the last few steps and enters the cellar, closing the door behind him, which has no lock. The cellar is lined with metal racks cluttered with canned merchandise, extension cables, cleaning materials, decorations, and outdoor implements. Merrill searches through the racks frantically as Graham places his ear to the door and listens. Merrill shifts to another set of racks, knocking items to the floor, and there is scratching against the door. The doorknob rotates, and Graham seizes it with both hands as the door starts to push open. A singular light bulb hangs from a wire in the ceiling, the only light in the area. Merrill reaches between two stacks of racks and pulls out a pick for digging in the earth with a three-foot wooden handle, holding it up in the air. He swivels and dashes in Graham's direction, clipping the light bulb with the end of the wooden handle as he crosses the area. Merrill turns the channel knob and checks all the stations, listening to the faint hum from the speakers. Graham steps into the beam of lights, glances at the door, and then turns to face the lights. Graham glances at Merrill's corner of the obscurity as Morgan moves his beam onto Merrill, placing the flashlight on the floor and rolling it across. The flashlight comes to a halt in Graham's grasp, and he picks it up. Merrill slowly recovers his breath and reaches over to his side to seize the remaining flashlight, directing the beam. Merrill glances at his nephew turning ashen as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body and speaks into the child's ear.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Bo was put down in the hallway by Graham, and she stood close to him as the four of them were quietly standing in a tight group. Morgan looked at his father, unable to speak, and all four were looking up. The boarded bedroom doors at the top of the stairs were looked at by Merrill as Morgan's hand was taken by Graham, who smiled down at his son, who gently smiled back. The top of the stairs was watched by the group of four, and the bedroom doors were quietly looked above by Merrill's eyes to the ceiling of the upstairs hallway, where a rectangle with a tiny rope hanging from it was stared at by him. A set of long fingers reaching under the front door, which changed to the exact color and texture of the yellow cracked paint on the door, was watched frozen by Morgan and Bo. The front hall was arrived in by Graham and Merrill, and Morgan and Bo were taken by the hand by Graham, who led them quickly down the hall as the top of the stairs was watched by Merrill backing away. The last few steps were descended by Graham before the basement was entered, and the door was closed behind him, which had no lock. Metal shelves cluttered with canned goods, extension cords, cleaning supplies, decorations, and outdoor tools lined the basement. The shelves were rummaged through frantically by Merrill as the door was listened to by Graham with his ear pressed against it. Another set of shelves was moved to by Merrill, knocking things to the ground, and scratching was heard against the door. The doorknob was turned, and it was grabbed by Graham with both hands as the door began to be pushed open. A single light bulb hanging from a wire in the ceiling was the only light illuminating the room. A pick for digging in the ground with a three-foot wooden handle was pulled out by Merrill from between two stacks of shelves, holding it up in the air. Turning and rushing in Graham's direction, the light bulb was clipped with the end of the wooden handle by him as the room was crossed. The channel knob was turned by Merrill, and all the stations were checked, listening to the light hum from the speakers. Graham stepped into the beam of lights, looked at the door, and then turned to face the lights. The darkness of Merrill's corner was looked at by Graham as Merrill was moved onto by Morgan's beam, putting the flashlight on the ground and rolling it across. The flashlight was stopped in Graham's palm, and it was picked up by him. Merrill slowly caught his breath and reached over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight, training the beam. Merrill looked at his nephew turning gray as Morgan was pulled closer to his body by Graham, who talked into the child's ear.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Graham places Bo down in the hallway, and she stays close as the four stand quietly together. Morgan looks at his father, speechless, and they all glance up. Merrill gazes at the boarded bedroom doors while Graham takes Morgan's hand, smiling at his son, who smiles back. They watch the top of the stairs, and Merrill's eyes shift to the ceiling, focusing on a rectangle with a tiny rope. Morgan and Bo freeze as long fingers appear under the front door, mimicking the yellow cracked paint. Graham and Merrill rush to the front hall, with Graham leading Morgan and Bo down the hall as Merrill backs away, watching the stairs. Graham enters the basement, closing the door without a lock. The basement is cluttered with metal shelves holding canned goods, cords, cleaning supplies, decorations, and tools. Merrill frantically searches the shelves while Graham listens at the door. The doorknob turns, and Graham grabs it as the door pushes open. A single light bulb hangs from the ceiling, the room's only light. Merrill finds a digging pick with a three-foot handle and rushes toward Graham, accidentally hitting the light bulb. Merrill checks the stations, listening to the hum from the speakers. Graham steps into the light, looks at the door, then turns to face the lights. He looks at Merrill's corner as Morgan moves his beam onto Merrill, rolling the flashlight across. It stops in Graham's hand, and he picks it up. Merrill catches his breath, grabs the remaining flashlight, and trains the beam. Merrill sees his nephew turning gray as Graham pulls Morgan closer, speaking into his ear.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Graham places Bo in the hallway, and she stays close as they stand in a tight group. Morgan looks at his father, speechless, and they all glance up. Merrill eyes the boarded bedroom doors as Graham smiles at Morgan, who smiles back. They watch the stairs, and Merrill's gaze shifts to a ceiling rectangle with a tiny rope. Morgan and Bo freeze as long fingers under the front door mimic the yellow paint. Graham and Merrill enter the hall, and Graham leads Morgan and Bo away as Merrill watches the stairs. Graham enters the basement, closing the door without a lock. The basement has shelves with canned goods, cords, and tools. Merrill searches frantically as Graham listens at the door. The doorknob turns, and Graham holds it as the door pushes open. A single bulb lights the room. Merrill grabs a digging pick and rushes, hitting the bulb. He checks stations, hearing a hum. Graham steps into the light, looks at the door, then faces the lights. Morgan rolls a flashlight to Graham, who picks it up. Merrill catches his breath, grabs another flashlight, and looks at his nephew turning gray as Graham pulls Morgan close and whispers to him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Graham gently places Bo down in the dimly lit hallway, and she instinctively stands close to him, seeking comfort and security as the four of them gather quietly in a tight-knit group. Morgan, feeling overwhelmed and unable to find his voice, looks up at his father with wide eyes, and all four of them direct their gaze upward. Merrill's eyes are drawn to the stairs, where he focuses intently on the boarded-up bedroom doors. Meanwhile, Graham tenderly takes Morgan's hand, offering a reassuring smile to his son, who responds with a gentle smile of his own. The group of four then turns their attention to the top of the stairs, where Merrill's eyes quietly scan above the bedroom doors, eventually settling on the ceiling of the upstairs hallway. There, he fixates on a rectangle with a tiny rope dangling from it. 

Morgan and Bo stand frozen in place, their eyes locked on a set of long, eerie fingers that creep under the front door, morphing seamlessly to match the exact color and texture of the yellow, cracked paint on the door. As tension mounts, Graham and Merrill swiftly arrive in the front hall. Graham takes Morgan and Bo by the hand, leading them quickly and purposefully down the hall, while Merrill cautiously backs away, his eyes never leaving the top of the stairs. Graham descends the last few steps and enters the basement, closing the door behind him, though it lacks a lock for security. 

The basement is a cluttered space, its walls lined with metal shelves overflowing with canned goods, tangled extension cords, various cleaning supplies, seasonal decorations, and an assortment of outdoor tools. Merrill, in a state of urgency, rummages frantically through the shelves, knocking items to the ground in his haste. Meanwhile, Graham presses his ear against the door, listening intently. The sound of scratching against the door fills the air, and as the doorknob begins to turn, Graham grips it tightly with both hands, struggling to keep the door from pushing open. 

A single light bulb, suspended from a wire in the ceiling, provides the only illumination in the room. Merrill reaches between two stacks of shelves, retrieving a pick designed for digging in the ground, its three-foot wooden handle clutched firmly in his grasp. He raises it into the air and rushes toward Graham, inadvertently clipping the light bulb with the end of the wooden handle as he crosses the room. Merrill then turns the channel knob, checking all the stations and listening to the faint hum emanating from the speakers. 

Graham steps into the beam of light, casting a glance at the door before turning to face the lights. He looks toward Merrill's corner of the darkness, and as Morgan moves his beam onto Merrill, he places the flashlight on the ground, rolling it across the floor. The flashlight comes to a stop in Graham's palm, and he picks it up with determination. Merrill, slowly regaining his composure, catches his breath and reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight, training its beam with precision. Merrill looks at his nephew, who appears to be turning gray, as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body, whispering softly into the child's ear.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Graham carefully and gently places Bo down in the dimly lit hallway, where soft shadows dance across the walls. She instinctively stands close to him, seeking both comfort and a sense of security as the four of them, connected by their shared experience, gather together quietly in a tight-knit, protective group. Morgan, feeling overwhelmed by the gravity of the situation and unable to find his voice, looks up at his father with wide, innocent eyes. All four of them direct their gaze upward, a shared moment of silent understanding passing between them. Merrill's eyes are particularly drawn to the stairs, where he focuses intently on the ominously boarded-up bedroom doors. Meanwhile, Graham tenderly takes Morgan's hand, offering a reassuring and warm smile to his son, who responds with a gentle smile of his own, filled with mutual comfort. The group of four then turns their attention to the top of the stairs, where Merrill's eyes quietly scan the area above those foreboding bedroom doors, eventually settling on the ceiling of the upstairs hallway. There, he fixates on a rectangle with a tiny rope dangling from it, a detail that seems to capture his full concentration. 

Morgan and Bo stand frozen in place, their wide eyes locked on a set of long, eerie fingers that creep under the front door. These fingers morph seamlessly and unsettlingly to match the exact color and texture of the yellow, cracked paint on the door, heightening the sense of tension. As the tension mounts to an almost unbearable level, Graham and Merrill swiftly arrive in the front hall. Graham takes both Morgan and Bo by the hand, leading them quickly and purposefully down the hall, while Merrill cautiously backs away, his eyes never leaving the top of the stairs, as if expecting something at any moment. Graham descends the last few steps with urgency and enters the basement, carefully closing the door behind him, although he knows it lacks a lock for security, adding a layer of anxiety. 

The basement is a cluttered space, with its walls lined with metal shelves that are overflowing with canned goods, tangled extension cords, various cleaning supplies, seasonal decorations, and an assortment of outdoor tools. In a state of urgency, Merrill frantically rummages through the shelves, knocking items to the ground in his haste to find what he seeks. Meanwhile, Graham presses his ear firmly against the door, listening intently to the ominous sounds outside. The sound of scratching against the door fills the air, and as the doorknob begins to turn with increasing pressure, Graham grips it tightly with both hands, struggling to keep the door from being pushed open.

A single light bulb, suspended from a wire in the ceiling, provides the only illumination, casting long shadows on the walls of the room. Merrill reaches between two stacks of shelves, retrieving a pick designed specifically for digging in the ground, its three-foot wooden handle clutched firmly in his grasp. He raises the tool into the air and rushes toward Graham with determination, inadvertently clipping the light bulb with the end of the wooden handle as he crosses the room. Merrill then turns the channel knob on the radio, checking all the stations and listening intently to the faint hum that emanates from the speakers, desperately searching for any sign of communication.

Graham steps into the beam of light, casting a cautious glance at the door before turning to face the dim lights. He looks toward Merrill's shadowed corner of the darkness, and as Morgan carefully moves his beam onto Merrill, he places the flashlight on the ground, watching it roll softly across the floor. The flashlight comes to a gentle stop in Graham's palm, and he picks it up with determination and resolve. Merrill, slowly regaining his composure, catches his breath and reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight, training its beam with precision and care. Merrill looks at his nephew, who appears to be turning gray with fear, as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body, whispering softly and comfortingly into the child's ear, offering words of reassurance.

Merrill moves to another set of shelves, continuing his frantic search, as scratching sounds emerge from the door. Merrill, in his search, reaches between two stacks of shelves and retrieves a pick for digging, with a three-foot wooden handle, raising it into the air. He turns and rushes toward Graham, inadvertently clipping the light bulb with the end of the wooden handle as he crosses the room. Merrill then turns the channel knob, checking all the stations and listening to the faint hum from the speakers. The flashlight comes to a stop in Graham's palm, and he picks it up. Merrill, gradually regaining his composure, reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight, directing its beam. test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Graham sets Bo down in the hallway, and the four of them stand closely together, silently observing their surroundings. Morgan looks at his father, who reassures him with a smile, and they all turn their attention to the top of the stairs. Merrill's gaze shifts from the boarded bedroom doors to a rectangle on the ceiling with a tiny rope. Meanwhile, Morgan and Bo watch in shock as long fingers appear under the front door, mimicking the door's yellow cracked paint. Graham and Merrill quickly lead Morgan and Bo down the hall, with Merrill keeping an eye on the stairs. They enter the basement, which is cluttered with various items, and Graham listens intently at the door as Merrill searches the shelves frantically. As scratching sounds emerge and the doorknob turns, Graham holds the door shut. Merrill retrieves a digging pick and rushes toward Graham, accidentally hitting the light bulb. In the dim light, Merrill checks the radio stations, while Graham and Merrill coordinate with flashlights. Graham reassures Morgan, pulling him closer, as Merrill steadies himself and grabs another flashlight, focusing its beam.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Graham puts Bo down in the hallway, a modest corridor typical of rural homes, and she stands close to him as the four of them stand quietly in a tight group. Morgan looks at his father, unable to speak, and all four look up. Merrill looks up the stairs at the boarded bedroom doors, reminiscent of makeshift storm protections, as Graham takes Morgan's hand and smiles down at his son, who smiles gently back. The group of four turns and watches the top of the stairs, and Merrill's eyes move quietly above the bedroom doors to the ceiling of the upstairs hallway, where he stares at a rectangle with a tiny rope hanging from it, an attic door that hasn't been opened for years. Morgan and Bo are frozen, watching a set of long fingers reach under the front door, which disturbingly change to the exact color and texture of the yellow cracked paint, reminiscent of neglected older buildings, on the door. Graham and Merrill arrive in the front hall, a space echoing with their hurried footsteps, and Graham takes Morgan and Bo by the hand, leading them quickly down the hall as Merrill backs away while watching the top of the stairs anxiously, aware of the potential danger lurking above. Graham comes down the last few steps and enters the basement, a space often used as a storm shelter in rural areas, closing the door behind him, which has no lock. The basement is lined with metal shelves cluttered with canned goods, a testament to the family's preparedness, extension cords, cleaning supplies, decorations, and outdoor tools. Merrill rummages through the shelves frantically as Graham puts his ear to the door and listens for any sign of movement. Merrill moves to another set of shelves, knocking things to the ground, and there is scratching against the door. The doorknob turns, and Graham grabs it with both hands as the door begins to push open. A single light bulb hangs from a wire in the ceiling, casting a dim glow, the only light in the room. Merrill reaches between two stacks of shelves and pulls out a pick, a tool for digging in the ground with a three-foot wooden handle, holding it up in the air. He turns and rushes in Graham's direction, clipping the light bulb with the end of the wooden handle as he crosses the room. Merrill turns the channel knob on an old radio and checks all the stations, listening to the faint static and hum from the speakers. Graham steps into the beam of lights, looks at the door, and then turns to face the lights. Graham looks at Merrill's corner of the darkness as Morgan moves his beam onto Merrill, putting the flashlight on the ground and rolling it across. The flashlight comes to a stop in Graham's palm, and he picks it up. Merrill slowly catches his breath and reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight, training the beam with the focus of someone used to power outages. Merrill looks at his nephew turning gray, a sign of the stress and fear affecting the child, as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body and talks into the child's ear, offering comforting words in the tense situation.

Graham looks at Merrill's corner of the darkness as Morgan moves his beam onto Merrill putting the flashlight on the ground and rolling it across. The flashlight comes to a stop in Graham's palm and he picks it up. Merrill slowly catches his breath and reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight training the beam. Merrill looks at his nephew turning gray as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body and talks into the child's ear.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Graham puts Bo down in the hallway and she stands close to him as the four of them stand quietly in a tight group. Morgan looks at his father unable to speak and all four look up. Merrill slowly catches his breath and reaches over to his side to grab the remaining flashlight training the beam. Merrill looks at his nephew turning gray as Graham pulls Morgan closer to his body and talks into the child's ear.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Daphne places Rex in the garden and he hops near her as the trio gathers loudly in an open cluster. Evan gazes at his uncle, unwilling to sing, and all three glance down. Nolan glances down the path at the hidden cellar entries as Daphne catches Evan's elbow and frowns up at her nephew, who chuckles softly in return. The trio of three shifts and observes the end of the hallway, and Nolan's ears twitch softly below the attic hatches to the floor of the downstairs den, where he peers at a square with a tiny chain dangling from it. Evan and Rex are animated observing a pair of short toes slide above the back window, which shift to the precise shade and feel of blue smooth tiles on the window. Daphne and Nolan appear in the back den, and Daphne grasps Evan and Rex by the waist, guiding them slowly along the corridor as Nolan leans forward while inspecting the end of the hallway. Daphne ascends the first few rungs and exits the attic, closing the window behind her, which has no latch. The attic is stacked with plastic crates loaded with dried foods, jumper cables, hygiene items, ornaments, and indoor gadgets. Nolan scours through the crates weakly as Daphne puts her elbow to the window and tastes. Nolan shifts to another row of crates, nudging objects to the sky, and there is knocking on the window. The latch shakes, and Daphne catches it with both feet as the window ceases to slide shut. A single candle dangles from a rope on the floor, the only glow in the space. Nolan reaches beneath two towers of crates and pulls out a rake for planting in the soil with a five-foot plastic handle, waving it down to the ground. He spins and strolls away from Daphne's position, jabbing the candle with the tip of the plastic handle as he crosses the space. Nolan flips the volume dial and tests all the channels, ignoring the heavy buzz from the headphones. Daphne dances away from the curtain of shadows, listens to the window, and then spins to address the shadows. Daphne glances at Nolan's edge of the light as Evan shifts his curtain onto Nolan, tossing the lantern to the ceiling and tossing it around. The lantern glides into Daphne's elbow, and she tosses it back. Nolan silently catches his sigh and leans over to his head to push the fallen lantern, dimming the glow. Nolan glances at his aunt ripening white as Daphne shoves Evan further from her shoulder and echoes into the creature's tail.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Graham places Bo down, and the group of four, including Morgan and Merrill, stands closely together, looking up anxiously. Merrill's eyes follow the ceiling, particularly noticing the attic entry as Graham reassures Morgan with a smile. Suddenly, they see fingers slipping under the front door, mimicking its yellow paint texture. Graham leads Morgan and Bo quickly down the hallway to the basement, as Merrill retreats, bracing for what's to come. In the basement, cluttered with various items, Merrill searches frantically, while Graham listens intently at the unsecured door as it starts to open. Merrill finds a digging pick and rushes to Graham, accidentally hitting the lone light bulb, leaving them in partial darkness. He checks radio channels for any sign of hope. Graham steps into the light's path, hands Merrill a flashlight, and they proceed to secure the room. Merrill catches his breath and focuses on the scene, while Graham keeps Morgan close, comforting him.
